meanings.definition: The quality or state of being disruptive.
meanings.sent1: Her disruptiveness in class made it hard for others to focus.
meanings.sent2: The disruptiveness of the construction noise was bothersome.
meanings.sent3: The disruptiveness of the puppy's playful behavior was both endearing and chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The disruptiveness of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The disruptiveness of the alarm clock ensured he never overslept.

meanings.definition: The tendency to cause disturbance or interruption.
meanings.sent1: The disruptiveness of the toddler's tantrum was hard to ignore.
meanings.sent2: The disruptiveness of the power outage affected the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The disruptiveness of the squirrel's antics entertained the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The disruptiveness of the traffic jam brought the city to a standstill.
meanings.sent5: The disruptiveness of the fire alarm was a necessary precaution in case of emergency.
